text: The San Fernando Valley (known as "The Valley") is an urbanized valley in the Los Angeles metropolitan area of southern California. It has the mountains of the Transverse Ranges circling it. It is home to 1.8 million people. It lies north of the larger and more populous Los Angeles Basin. Nearly two thirds of the Valley's land area is part of the City of Los Angeles. The other incorporated cities in the Valley are Glendale, Burbank, San Fernando, Hidden Hills, and Calabasas. ==Other websites== * CSUN Digital Library: San Fernando Valley online Archives : vintage photos-maps-histories. * CSUN: San Fernando Valley Statistics website * CSUN San Fernando Valley Economic Research Center website Category:Valleys of California Category:Geography of Los Angeles
title: San Fernando Valley
